intro: Ceratosanthes latiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaved ceratosanthes, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with opposite, simple, and often heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive spurred shape at the base. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is adapted to moist, well-drained soils.
